name: Ajsone
description: Language defined completely in JSON.

name: Befunge
description: Two-dimensional language.

name: Brainfuck
description: Minimalist language using only 8 single-character commands.

name: Chef
description: Programs that look like cooking recipes.

name: Chicken
description: Only 1 valid symbol: 'chicken'.

name: ChuckScript
description: Unary-based language, where the code is a single number.

name: DNA#
description: Language based on the structure of the DNA.

name: Dots
description: A turing-complete language with only one symbol: ".".

name: Emojicode
description: Full-blown programming language consisting of emojis.

name: False
description: Heavily offuscated language with a minimal implementation.

name: Fetlang
description: Designed such that source code looks like poorly written fetish erotica.

name: INTERCAL
description: Parody language intended to be completely different from other languages.

name: JSFuck
description: Esoteric programming style based on the atomic parts of JavaScript.

name: LolCode
description: Language with keywords based on the lolcat meme expressions.

name: Malbolge
description: Named after the 8th level of hell, is designed to be as difficult as possible to program.

name: Omgrofl
description: Syntax resembling Internet slang.

name: Ook!
description: Brainfuck-based language, where the commands are orangutan words.

name: reMorse
description: Morse-styled language.

name: Piet
description: Language in which programs look like abstract paintings using colors as code. Named after Piet Mondrian.

name: Shakespeare
description: Language where the code appear to be Shakespearean plays.

name: Suzy
description: 3D language inspired in Befunge.

name: Thue
description: Matrioshka language based on nondeterministic string rewriting of a semi-Thue grammar.

name: Unary
description: Brainfuck-based language where all the commands are 0.

name: Velato
description: Language that uses MIDI files as source, programs are defined by the pitch and order of notes.

name: Whenever
description: Language that does things whenever it wants.

name: Whitespace
description: Use only white-characters (space, tabs and newlines).

name: Z
description: Use only the letter z.

name: DM's Esoteric Programming Languages
description: List of esoteric languages and algorithms written by dangermouse.

name: Esofiles
description: The Esoteric Files Archive, an archive of implementations of esoteric programming languages and examples.

name: Esolang
description: Wiki of esoteric programming languages and related Resources.

name: Progopedia
description: List of esoteric languages.

name: Rosettacode
description: Provides examples in different languages, including esoteric languages.

name: Wikipedia/Esoteric programming languages
description: Wikipedia list of esoteric languages.

name: On the Turing Completeness Of MS PowerPoint
description: Turing Machine on PowerPoint

name: Let's Build a Basic Interpreter (Ruslan's Blog)
description: Series of articles explaining the basics of compilers and interpreters and how to build one.

name: Six programming paradigms that will change how you think about coding
description: A post by Yevgeniy Brikman describing different programming paradigms that are not commonly applied.

name: Freenode IRC Channel
description: The #esoteric IRC channel on freenode.

name: Reddit Esolangs
description: Reddit community on esolangs.
